excerpt: A compact Dobsonian made for small patios and large existential questions.
title: Hadley 3D — Desktop Dobsonian (3D-printed)
html: Hadley 3D — Desktop Dobsonian (3D-printed) is what happens when a telescope shrugs and decides to live on a desk instead of a mountaintop. Printed in layered plastic that still remembers the warmth of the nozzle, it cradles a small Newtonian mirror and points it, patiently, at whatever slice of sky the window will allow. The motions are simple, almost stubborn: up, down, left, right, like a wooden toy that learned orbital mechanics from a library book. It will not change the course of any galaxy, and the stars will not blink in appreciation, but it will quietly fold distant light into a circle of glass and offer it to whoever is still awake. A small machine, doing its best to make the universe feel closer, even as the universe keeps drifting away.
